DataElement.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Group Disease Progression Medical Imaging Documented Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether RECIST disease progression was determined by radiographic imaging.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Group Disease Progression Medical Imaging Documented
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the growth or spread of a disease as defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Group and documented by imaging technology, the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Disease Progression
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com):Cancer that continues to grow or spread.

Concepts.longName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

Property.preferredDefinition: In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.:Documented; furnished with or supported by documents.

Concepts.definition: In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.
Furnished with or supported by documents and documentation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Increase by >50% in tumor size from nadir

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient's disease progressed per RECIST v1.1 criteria

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Radiographic evidence of disease progression by RECIST v1.1 criteria in the 12 months prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Radiographic Evidence of Disease Progression by RECIST v1.1 Criteria in the 12 Months Prior to Registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have centrally-confirmed radiographic disease progression per RECIST v1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the Alliance ICL at IROC Ohio central radiographic review confirmed disease progression by RECIST v1.1?
